CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDSeBT: This is a specific material name mentioned multiple times in the paragraph. It is a type of organic semiconductor used in the photovoltaic cells.
2. PC71BM: This is another specific material name mentioned multiple times in the paragraph. It is also an organic semiconductor used in the photovoltaic cells.
3. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency, which is a parameter used to measure the efficiency of the photovoltaic cells.
4. J SC: This stands for Short Circuit Current Density, which is another parameter used to measure the performance of the photovoltaic cells.
5. V OC: This stands for Open Circuit Voltage, which is a parameter used to measure the maximum voltage that the photovoltaic cell can generate under illumination.
6. FF: This stands for Fill Factor, which is a parameter used to measure the efficiency of the photovoltaic cell at converting electrical power at the maximum power point.
7. w/w: This stands for weight/weight, which is a unit used to describe the weight ratio of two materials.
8. OTS: This stands for Octadecyltrichlorosilane, which is a material used to treat the Si/SiO2 substrates.
9. Si: This stands for Silicon, which is a material used for the substrate.
10. SiO2: This stands for Silicon Dioxide, which is a material used as a layer on the Si substrate.
11. ITO: This stands for Indium Tin Oxide, which is a material used as a transparent conductive electrode.
12. PEDOT:PSS: This stands for Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):Poly(styrenesulfonate), which is a material used as a hole transport layer.
13. Al: This stands for Aluminum, which is a material used as a back contact in the photovoltaic cells.
14. AM 1.5G: This refers to a standard solar spectrum used for testing the performance of photovoltaic cells.
15. IPCE: This stands for Incident Photon-to-Current Efficiency, which is a parameter used to measure the efficiency of the photovoltaic cell in converting photons into electrical current.
16. I on / I off : This refers to the on/off current ratio, which is a parameter used to measure the sensitivity and selectivity of the photovoltaic cell.
17. AFM: This stands for Atomic Force Microscopy, which is a technique used to gain insight into the surface morphology of materials.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. Si
4. SiO2
5. ITO
6. PEDOT:PSS
7. Al
8. OTS (as it is a material used to treat the substrate, but not a material name itself)

So, the relevant material names in the paragraph are: PCDSeBT, PC71BM, Si, SiO2, ITO, PEDOT:PSS, and Al.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| Si |
| SiO2 |
| ITO |
| PEDOT:PSS |
| Al |

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

4. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE (Percentage of efficiency) of the initial device: 0.73%
2. J SC (Short-circuit current density) of the initial device: 2.98 mA / cm^2
3. V OC (Open-circuit voltage) of the initial device: 0.71 V
4. FF (Fill factor) of the initial device: 35%
5. PCE of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 4.12%
6. J SC of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 11.7 mA / cm^2
7. V OC of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 0.79 V
8. FF of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 45%
9. J SC of PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues (reported in literature): 1.0 × 10^-3 to 4.0 × 10^4 -13 mA / cm^2
10. I on / I off (On-current / Off-current) ratio: N/A (not provided in the text)
11. IPCE (Incident photon-to-current efficiency) at the energetically lower peak: over 65%
12. J SC calculated from IPCE data: N/A (not provided in the text)
13. Device dimensions: L = 50 μm, W = 1.5 mm

Note: The values for J SC, V OC, and FF are given for both the initial and optimized devices. The J SC values reported in the literature are a range, not specific to any one device. The I on / I off ratio and J SC calculated from IPCE data are not provided in the text.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCE (Percentage of efficiency) of the initial device: 0.73%

3. V OC (Open-circuit voltage) of the initial device: 0.71 V
4. PCE of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 4.12%
5. J SC of the device with 1 : 4 w / w blend: 11.7 mA / cm^2
6. J SC of PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues (reported in literature): N/A
7. IPCE (Incident photon-to-current efficiency) at the energetically lower peak: over 65%
8. J SC calculated from IPCE data: N/A

Note: The values for J SC, V OC, and PCE are given for both the initial and optimized devices. The J SC values reported in the literature are not specific values, but rather a range. The I on / I off ratio and J SC calculated from IPCE data are not provided in the text.

| J SC (optimized) | 11.7 mA / cm^2               |

Note: The values for J SC, V OC, and PCE are given for both the initial and optimized devices. The J SC values reported in the literature are not specific values, but rather a range. The I on / I off ratio and J SC calculated from IPCE data are not provided in the text.
